means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 赫德 Heard的变体
flock ： 主要指鸟群、羊群；也指较小的动物群，也可指人群。
herd ： 一般指大动物的群，尤指家畜的群，也可指人群。
swarm ： 通常指蜜蜂、昆虫等的群。

sentence.Network_en: Stefano used a motor cycle to herd the sheep.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯特凡诺骑一辆摩托车放羊。

sentence.Network_en: A herd of elephants lolloped across the plains towards a watering hole.
sentence.Network_cn: 一群大象缓慢而笨拙地穿过平原，朝水潭走去。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English heord, of Germanic origin; related to German Herde

entry.def: A herd is a large group of animals of one kind that live together.

entry.tran: （缺乏独立思想的）一般民众，芸芸众生
entry.def: If you say that someone has joined the herd or follows the herd, you are criticizing them because you think that they behave just like everyone else and do not think for themselves.

example.ex: They are individuals; they will not follow the herd.
example.tran: 他们是独立的个体，不愿随大溜。

entry.tran: 使集在一起;把…赶在一起
entry.def: If you herd people somewhere, you make them move there in a group.

example.ex: He began to herd the prisoners out...
example.tran: 他开始将犯人集中在一起赶出来。

example.ex: The group was herded into a bus.
example.tran: 这群人被赶上了一辆公共汽车。

entry.def: If you herd animals, you make them move along as a group.

example.ex: Stefano used a motor cycle to herd the sheep...
example.tran: 斯特凡诺骑一辆摩托车放羊。

example.ex: A boy herded half a dozen camels down towards the water trough.
example.tran: 一个男孩赶着6头骆驼朝饮水槽走去。

means.word_mean: 1. a group of cattle or sheep or other domestic mammals all of the same kind that are herded by humans
2. a group of wild animals of one species that remain together: antelope or elephants or seals or whales or zebra
3. a crowd especially of ordinary or undistinguished persons or things;

sentences.sentence: "his brilliance raised him above the ruck"

means.word_mean: 1. cause to herd, drive, or crowd together;

sentences.sentence: "We herded the children into a spare classroom"
"Who will be herding the cattle when the cowboy dies?"

auth_sentence.content: Their daily commitment to their herd makes it impossible.
auth_sentence.res_content: Their daily commitment to their herd makes it impossible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Their daily commitment to their herd makes it impossible.

auth_sentence.content: For them, herd immunity is the only defense.
auth_sentence.res_content: For them, herd immunity is the only defense.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For them, herd immunity is the only defense.

auth_sentence.content: You'll make tracks like a herd of elephants.
auth_sentence.res_content: You'll make tracks like a herd of elephants.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You'll make tracks like a herd of elephants.

Sentence.sentence: Why can't the herd be thinned the old-fashioned way?

sentences.en: She drove the herd of cattle through the wilderness.
“It is the luxurious and dissipated who set the fashions which the herd so diligently follow”(Henry David Thoreau)
sentences.cn: “是奢侈和放荡的人制造了民众孜孜不倦地追求的时尚”(亨利·戴维·索罗)

sentences.en: The little boy is herding the cattle.

jushi.english: He preferred to stick with the common herd.

jushi.chinese: 骆驼三五成群地在吃草。

jushi.english: Herds of elephants were moving across the plain.
